bibl.title: G.M. Savage v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss

D P Ballard being duly sworn upon oath says: that about March 28th 1884 applicant was and now is one of the attys for Distina Z. Carmey; that about said time said Distina Z. Carmey as a in intrust caused one G M Savage to be arrested by the Probate Judge of Chehalis County and by said Probate Judge ordered committed to the jail of Thurston County; that at said time William Billings Sheriff of said Thurston County as such Sheriff had charge of said Thurston County jail; that the Sheriff of Chehalis County delivered said G M Savage to said Billings as such Sheriff and keeper of said jail of said Thurston County; that said Billings as such keeper was entitled to demand and receive the sum of one dollar per day and no more for receiving and keeping said G M Savage in said Thurston County jail; that said Billings and one C B Harman Deputy Sheriff Kep. of said Savage in said jail for the space of twenty four hours and no more; and that said Billings as such Sheriff and Keeper of said jail by said C B Harman his deputy did demand and receive from this applicant as atty for said Distina Z. Carmey the sum of ten dollars in for keeping said Savage in said jail for the space of said 24 hours; that after due demand to the said Sheriff refused and still refuses to the same.
Subscribed and sworn to before me May 31 1884 C W Hauman Notary Public Thurston County Wash Ty.
G.M. Savage Ex parte Plaintiff vs. Habeas Corpus Defendant Motion to tax costs
Received and Filed Jun 3 1884 R.G. O'Bruin
